mobile.name: lady sedu sing
mobile.desc: This stunning sibyl's porcelain face is graced with dark eyes residing under arched, ebony eyebrows. Her exquisite, scarlet lips hold an alluring smile. Her hips sway fluidly as does her raven tresses about her shoulders. Her diaphanous, sable-coloured robes flow about her like a caressing shadow, light and ethereal. A ring of crimson ribbon encircles the one-shoulder style around her neck. The robe seductively exposes her left, alabaster shoulder. Silver bangles ting about her wrists. An arabesque, silver ring holds a large, brilliant ruby.
mobile.long: The hair of Lady Sedu Sing, this captivating clairvoyant, lingers upon a breeze.

mobile.desc: This grubby barkeep wipes down the bar methodically. With one wild, unblinking, bloodshot eye he sizes up all who enter his establishment. When he throws his wry smile, only three teeth are discernable. His flabby body is clad in a leather apron, large, clunking boots, and a filthy grey shirt with the sleeves rolled up. The odour of raw onions lingers in his breath and his aversion to bathing is apparent.

extradesc.desc: This is quite possibly the best broom on the market. The mark on it's handle tells you it's a Firebolt model, but most wouldn't need that to identify it. Its streamlined, superfine handle of ash makes its appearance different than other brooms. It is coated with some form of glimmery polish. When released it will hover to the correct mounting height. object.desc: A couch showing a moving wizards duel lies here.

extradesc.desc: This couch shows a lit, stone dungeon. Standing in it is a wizard in all blue robes, sporting a silver beard dueling against a wizard covered in a black cloak and hat. Almost all the time they fight each other, sending various curses shooting stars, snakes, or fire at their opponent. Occasionally, they take a breather, sit down, and appear to talk to each other as if they were old friends. It seems soon enough an argument springs up between them and they start dueling again.

object.name: display cases
object.desc: Several display cases are positioned around the room.

extradesc.desc: Arranged around the room in what looks like a haphazard fashion, the display cases are actually positioned to attract a customer's attention. They are filled with many different kinds of jewellery and gems. Delicate light washes through the cases to glitter on the gems and jewels.

object.name: emerald earring
object.desc: An elegant emerald earring is laying here.

extradesc.desc: The long elegant gold earring is shaped like a tear drop. A beautiful dark green emerald rests in the center of the tear drop. Small fringes of gold reach around the emerald to hold it in place. Twisted strips of gold form the top of the earring.

object.name: bloodstone pendent
object.desc: A bold bloodstone pendent is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Dark green with red spots, the bold bloodstone is wrapped with a bit of silver to form it into a pendent. The pendent is hanging on a compact silver chain. The silver chain is made from thin piece of silver weaved together, with tiny drops of gold set into the weaves to give it an accent.

object.name: birthstone sign
object.desc: A sign listing mystical birthstones is sitting on a display case.

object.name: jade bracelet
object.desc: A gentle jade bracelet is laying here.

extradesc.desc: The gentle jade bracelet is made from a series of olive green jade stones wrapped with thin threads of soft gold. Relaxing curls of gold hold the jade stones in place, creating a glittering frame for each stone.

object.name: opal ring
object.desc: An oval opal ring is laying here.

extradesc.desc: An iridescent, colourful oval opal is placed in the center of a smooth silver ring. A thin strip of silver wraps over the top of the gem stone to protect it, since opals are so fagile.

object.name: sappire anklet
object.desc: A silky sapphire anklet is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Deep blue silky sapphires line a thick gold chain anklet. Tiny strings of gold wrap around each individual sapphire, encasing them. Small drops of silver dot the gems, like bright stars that filling a midnight sky.

object.name: moonstone choker
object.desc: A magnificent moonstone choker is laying here.

extradesc.desc: The thick silver choker is inlaid with various designs and a single white moonstone that has a soft blue sheen. The moonstone reflects light in a distintive shimmer called adularescence. The patterns in the silver spider out from the moonstone, highlighting it.

object.name: ruby ring
object.desc: A radiant ruby ring is laying here.

extradesc.desc: A brilliant, crimson ruby is set into a fine, silver ring with various patterns drawn into the silver. The beautiful designs etched into the ring wrap and encircle the ruby, adding a unique look to the ring.

object.name: diamond bracelet
object.desc: A dazzling diamond bracelet is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Lined with dazzling colourless diamonds, the silver bracelet has thin threads of silver that wrap around each diamond. The threads of silver are twisted with threads of gold before being wound around the diamond.

object.name: agate pendent
object.desc: An amazing agate pendent is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Hanging from a thin gold chain, the striped, marble blue agate is partially enclosed in gold to form a pendent. Several strands of gold snake around the pendent and agate to hold it in place.

object.name: jasper earring
object.desc: A generous jasper earring is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Green jasper stones with greyish-blue marble lines are set in a long, dangling silver earring. Finger-like strips of silver grasp the jasper stones, protecting them.

object.name: pearl necklace
object.desc: A precious pearl necklace is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Silvery precious pearls are strung along a long gold chain, blending together the smooth white and bright gold colours. Drops of dazzling silver accent the gold chain.

object.name: onyx anklet
object.desc: A obscure onyx anklet is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Straight bands of blank onyx encircle a fine silver chain. The dark onyx and light silver create a powerful contrast to set off each colour, making it quite the balancing act between the powers of light and dark.

object.name: royal blue robe
object.desc: A royal blue robe is laying here.

extradesc.desc: Made of fine and expensive silk, this royal blue robe is great for keeping someone cool in the summer. It's definitely not something you would wear in the winter. Elegant and smooth, the robe is floor length, but just short enough so that it doesn't get dirty by dragging on the ground.

object.desc: A chocolate chip cookie sits here.

object.desc: A cup of tea sits here.

object.desc: A black pair of high heels sits here.
object.short: a black pair of high heels

object.desc: A pair of black suede dress shoes sits here.
object.short: a pair of black suede dress shoes

object.desc: A plate of yummy Thanksgiving Turkey Dinner

object.desc: A pile of money

object.name: bronze dragon claw earring
object.desc: A sharp, bronze, dragon claw earring lies here.

extradesc.desc: Made of smooth, high-quality bronze, the earring is made to look like the powerful claw of a dragon. The talons of the claw are designed to hang down from the wearer's ear, like they are reaching out to clutch its prey.

object.name: dragon fang necklace
object.desc: A dragon fang necklace lies here.

extradesc.desc: Made from several dragon fangs strung together, the necklace is heavy from the weight of the teeth. A couple of the fangs are scarred from use, while others are polished to a bright white, creating a nice contrast in the necklace.

object.name: silver ring
object.desc: A simple silver ring is resting here.

extradesc.desc: Made of fine silver, this ring is quite simple and smooth. It has no markings or engravings. It is not adorn in any way.

object.name: plain gold ring
object.desc: A plain gold ring is lying here.

extradesc.desc: The plain gold ring is made of very beautiful gold, creating a nice shine to its surface. It's a simple ring, but not all rings need to be extravagant. It's the kind of ring that would make a lovely gift without being too expensive.

object.name: a pair of bronze arm bands
object.desc: A pair of bronze arm bands are lying here.

extradesc.desc: Each band is made from a thick strip of shiny bronze that wraps a few times around the arm. The ends of the bronze band curl in on themselves. A bold pattern of sparks and stars is engraved on the bands.

object.short: a pair of bronze arm bands

object.name: golden circlet
object.desc: A golden circlet is lying here.

extradesc.desc: Inlaid with softly glowing, swirling designs, the golden circlet winds around the wearer's head. Little off-shoots of gold flair out from the circlet, shiny stars dance at the ends. The golden glow from the designs slowly spread out from the circlet to bath the wearer in a subtle light.

object.name: beaded necklace
object.desc: A beaded necklace is lying here.

extradesc.desc: Several glass beads are strung along a thick thread to form the necklace. The glass beads are clearish with a multitude of colours from the entire spectrum. There are crimson swirls throughout the coral beads and emerald dots on the yellow carmine beads, while bright violet circles the cobalt beads.

object.name: an empty cage
object.desc: An empty cage dangles outside magical menagerie

extradesc.desc: A lone brass cage floats outside of Magical Menagerie as if held up by invisible strings. The small mat on the bottom of the cage is decorated with a few feathers and crumbles left from a former residences lunch.

object.name: a garbage can
object.desc: A rusty old garbage can

extradesc.desc: A rusty garbage can sits outside the Quibbler Head Quarters. The large bin is piled high with the latest edition of 'The Quibbler'.

object.name: a flowery plant
object.desc: A flowering plant sits outside Reyna's Garden Supplies

extradesc.desc: The lush green plant sits outside Reyna's Garden Supplies. Young crimson buds mix with elegant flowers creating the loveliest arrangement of green and red. Little drops of water trail down the leaves into the soil bellow next to a small sign planted in the dirt. This plant looks good enough to eat!
The sign planted into the soil reads: This plant is poisonous! Do not eat!

object.name: a display window for lady gemma's fine jewelry
object.desc: A display window for lady gemma's fine jewelry

extradesc.desc: The display window for Lady Gemma's Fine Jewelry sets off colorful glimmers as the light hits the jewels. The rubies and emerald fill the case with soft red and green hues while the diamonds fill the case with light. A pair of bronze dragon claw earrings and a dragon fang necklace rest in the center of the case. A slogan under it reads: "Your friends will be in awe when you're wearing dragon claw."

object.short: a display window for lady gemma's fine jewelry

object.name: a cauldron
object.desc: A cauldron sits outside A Magi's Mechanisms

extradesc.desc: . A pewter cauldron sits next to the entrance . The cauldron is uniquely shaped, with the legs shaped as small paws. The rim of the cauldron is etched with various leaves and herbs. The Cauldron has several scratches across its surface.

object.name: a fake firebolt broom
object.desc: A broom marked, "Firebo1t" lies here.

extradesc.desc: Something doesn't seem quite right about this broom.
Wow! A firebolt! Hmm... something doesn't quite seem right. An insignia with the word "Firebo1t" in gold letters seems to have been pasted on to the wooden handle of the broom.
The "Firebo1t" insignia is pasted onto to dark-wood helm of the broom with strangely shoddy workmanship. Underneath it you think you can almost make out the word "Cleansweep".
Wow! A firebolt! Hmm... something doesn't quite seem right. An insignia with the word "Firebolt" in gold letters seems to have been pasted onto the wooden handle of the broom.

object.desc: An old, wooden directional sign stands here, pointing out directions.

extradesc.desc: The old, sign seems to be ancient, cracks run through it as though it has been repaired time, and time again and a few spots on it are scorched as if flames licked them. One sign crudely nailed to the post points east and reads in faded, red letters, "The Leaky Cauldron, Muggle London". One pointing to the south reads, "Knockturn Alley". One points to the west and reads, "Diagon Alley - Daily Prophet, Ollivanders".

extradesc.desc: A finely built armoir stands here, stretching up tall. Its doors have inlaid designs of lions staring at each other when the doors are closed. The corners and legs have carved-in sunburst designs. Its mahogany body appears quite old, however well kept.

object.name: qqs display window
object.desc: A glass display window for Quality Quidditch Supplies.

extradesc.desc:
.
An enchanting broom sits on a golden-wired stand, centered in the display window of Quality Quidditch Supplies. It has a perfectly sulpted, glossy frame and flawlessly aerodynamic twigs at the end.
Above the utopian broom is an oak plaque with some words etched in gold.
On the superb broom's handle is the following word engraved in black: "Firebolt"

.
An oak plaque hangs above an unequaled broom in the display case. The words written on it are etched in gold:
"Firebolt: The Fastest Racing Broom in the World."

.
This glass window is crystal clear. The clerks of Quality Quidditch Supplies have draped a plush red cloth around the border to add some flavour to the display. Behind the expo you can see racks of items, posters of various Quidditch players, and people bustling around.
However, what draws most people to look at this display window is the main spectacle. On a centered, golden-wired stand rests the beautiful racing broom.

object.short: a glass display window for quality quidditch supplies

object.name: standard bird cage
object.desc: A standard looking bird cage.

extradesc.desc:
.
A standard-looking, black bird cage rests near Eeylops Owl Emporium. It is made out of black iron and seems heavy. There is a brown, wooden bottom that hints a bird with a lazy owner once occupied the coop. There is a broken swing inside, and there is a rusted link at the top that would hang the cage on a hook.

A standard-looking, black bird cage rests near Eeylops Owl Emporium. It is made out of black iron and seems heavy. There is a brown, wooden bottom that hints a bird with a lazy owner once occupied the coop. There is a broken swing inside, and there is a rusted link at the top that would hang the cage on a hook.

object.name: a granite statue of a magpie perched
object.desc: A granite statue of a perched magpie is here.

extradesc.desc: This granite statue is set upon an attatched pedestal, it made of one piece of granite. The actual carved portion is carved amazingly well, the crafter had to have taken care with this. There is a small branch coming out of the pedestal where the magpie is perched, it's wings half open as if it has just landed and in its beak is an ornate ring. Beset in its eye sockets are black gems, glimmering.
extradesc.keywords: look granite statue magpie perched of a

object.short: a granite statue of a magpie

object.name: a long wooden bar with square wooden stools
object.desc: A long wooden bar with square wooden stools lines the north-eastern corner of the room.

extradesc.desc: This bar is very simple and utilitarian, as if the only demands of the carpenter were, "I need a bar." It is a simple wooden block, extending long enough for five basic uncomfortable-looking wooden stools to be parked in front of it. Overhead are small lights, to give the bartender a little illumination.
extradesc.keywords: look long wooden bar with square wooden stools

object.short: a long wooden bar with square wooden stools

object.name: a chipped white toilet
object.desc: A white toilet sits here, with a few chips in it.

object.name: a simple white bath
object.desc: A simple white bath is here.

object.name: a massive fireplace
object.desc: A massive fireplace stands against the wall here.

object.name: a spartan bed with a red cover
object.desc: A spartan bed with a red cover sits here.
object.short: a spartan bed with a red cover

object.name: a simple cedar dresser
object.desc: A simple cedar dresser stands here.

object.name: a white sink
object.desc: A white sink is adhered to the wall here.

object.name: a window display from the shop to the north, flourish & blotts
object.desc: A window display from the shop to the north, Flourish & Blotts is visible here.

extradesc.desc: . To the north is a huge window display, beset on both sides of Flourish & Blotts. Huge books with gold inlay rest on sturdy pillars, made of stone to withstand the probable weight of these paving slab size tomes. One reads simply, "Family Spellbooke" an odd spelling with a smaller subtitle that says, "Circa 1762." The others seem just as old and just as ornate.

object.short: a window display from the shop to the north, flourish & blotts

object.name: charcoal robe
object.desc: A long, flowing charcoal robe

extradesc.desc: The robe is long, flowing, and deep charcoal in colour.

object.name: simple rectangular desk number one chair
object.desc: A simple rectangular desk with the number one sits here with a chair behind it.
object.short: a simple rectangular desk with the number one with a chair behind it

object.short: a small silver key with the letters, "dp" engraved on the head

object.name: an old faded painting
object.desc: An old faded painting hangs on the wall here.

extradesc.desc: This painting is framed in simple stained wood that looks very old and warped. The painting itself is cracked and dry, it seeming neglected. It shows a wizard in plain dark blue robes standing in a dark wooded office. His face is pale and wrinkled, but with a vivacious look on his face. Below the painting is a small bronze plaque bolted into the aging frame that reads, "Bren Fonton - Inventor of Modern Printing Techniques"

object.name: the wwn spire
object.desc: The WWN Spire stands here, with a door beset in it. A plaque nailed to it bids you to read it.

extradesc.desc: The huge coral spire twists off into the sky here, surreal amidst its rather humble surroundings. A door into it is absolutely opaque, and is sealed around the edges with some kind of black foam. A sign reads, "BROADCASTING BOOTH - DO NOT ENTER UNLESS BROADCASTING".
extradesc.keywords: look read wwn spire door plaque

object.name: a chipped ceramic umbrella-stand umbrella stand
object.desc: A chipped ceramic umbrella-stand sits here.

extradesc.desc: This ceramic umbrella-stand has gotten a lot use, or as it appearance denotes, abuse. It is covered in layers of dust, dirt, and grime, marring its original terra cotta surface. Huge chips and cracks further blemish it, seeming to have been broken many times and reassembled.
extradesc.keywords: look chipped ceramic umbrella-stand umbrella stand

object.name: silver ring
object.desc: A plain silver ring lies on the floor.

extradesc.desc: . This plain silver band is cool to the touch. Upon gazing at its smooth surface, a calm falls over you. All your fears and worries ebb away like ripples on a glassy pond, radiating to nothingness away from you.

object.name: pink hard hat
object.desc: A pink hard hat.

extradesc.desc: This bright pink hard hat offers some extra protection to all who wear it.

object.name: healing cookie
object.desc: A lovely healing cookie.

extradesc.desc: This delicious snack heals minor wounds and scratches and has chocolate chips!

object.name: shiny pile
object.desc: A small pile of shiny coins.
object.short: a small pile of shiny coins.

object.name: a large advertisement on the eastern building
object.desc: A large advertisement is painted on the eastern wall.

extradesc.desc: Faded onto the bricks of the eastern building is a huge red rectangle of paint with towering white letters reading, "STEPPENWOLF'S MAGIC CARPET CLEANERS - 174 Diagon Alley, London". Flying through loops and gaps of the letters is a blue and purple carpet with golden tassels on its corners.

object.short: a large advert on the eastern building

object.name: a large trash container
object.desc: A large trash container sits here against the south wall.

extradesc.desc: As you peer into the large trash container, a huge amount of crumpled paper reveals itself to you. Amidst the mess are the scrapped bindings of a brown book that reads, "The Monster Book of Monsters".

object.name: a cheesy striped neck-tie neck tie

object.desc: A long, black, leather trenchcoat with silver buttons

object.name: black combat boots
object.desc: Black combat boots

room.name: The Leaky Cauldron - Back Alley
room.desc: This courtyard is stark and utilitarian. The lofty brick wall to the west is elevated to such lofty heights that it obstructs the view surrounding the tavern. Part of an alley is visible to the north, but it's simply occupied by rubbish and graffiti. A lone trash can, dented and rusty, sits along the wall. The odour in this tiny courtyard is stale and fetid. The door leading back into the Leaky Cauldron is to the east.

exit.name: northwest
exit.flags: door closed locked pickproof hard infuriating noclose oneway

room.name: Diagon Alley - Entrance
room.desc: This is the entrance to and exit from Diagon Alley, the famous shopping place of all magical folk in London. The cobbled road leading down the bending path indicates this place is old, quite old. The buildings are wooden and ancient, and seem to lean in a bit towards the cobblestone walkway, as if they are about to fall over. Diagon Alley is nearly always filled with witches and wizards bustling about, kids marveling at the newest broomstick model, and shopkeepers yelling out their newest deal. To the northeast is Slug & Jiggers Apothecary, a dark shop, and to the southwest is Callanthro's Cauldron Collage.

exit.name: southeast
exit.flags: door closed locked pickproof hard infuriating noclose

room.name: Slug & Jiggers Apothecary - Shop Front
room.desc: This cluttered room is filled with an overpowering stench of boiled cabbage. A dark, warm, wooden floor stretches from wall to wall, an ornately, carved desk lines one wall of the shop. The rich wood is covered with graceful, swirling patterns, though age has diminished the grandeur of the artwork. A large chandelier casts the room in a warm glow. It illuminates a southern exit to Diagon Alley as well as a door to the north.

extradesc.desc: The warm wood of the desk is accented with a deep, curving grain and ornate carving. Elegant designs in swirling shapes adorn the front and sides of the desk.

room.name: Callanthro's Cauldron Collage
room.desc: The large shop is nearly squared, bathed in the warm, orange glow of dozens of candles that are held in the sconces lining the walls. The floor and the lower half of the walls are made of golden, wood panelling, smoothly passing into an upper part painted with white and yellow vertical stripes. Along the north, southeast, and northwest walls are shelves upon shelves exhibiting cauldrons of various shapes and colours, all of which sport carefully-written labels. The finer specimens have been hauled to stand above gently-licking fires on identical, small tables, different contents bubbling happily in each of them. A fine, wooden desk, with an ornate register on its smooth top, stands on the northeastern side of the store, not five feet away from the welcoming, wooden door, that leads into Diagon Alley. Almost masked between another set of horizontal shelves is another, smaller door, leading deeper into the shop, while the spiralling staircase behind the wooden desk leads probably to a more private room.

extradesc.desc: An assortment of cauldrons lines the many shelves of this spacious store, ranging from tiny, golden-hued ones, that look more like artefacts than like real cauldrons, to some large enough to hold a crouching adult quite comfortably within. Each cauldron is labelled carefully with specification such as: minimal and average thickness, volume, material, and a list of substances which might damage it. A large, red, glowing stamp is set on each of the labels, spelling the letters: 'In agreement with the regulation on cauldron bottom thickness - Ministry of Magic'.

roomecho.desc: The cauldrons hiss and bubble above the dancing flames.

room.name: Callanthro's Cauldron Collage - Storage Room
room.desc: The tidy nature of the shop is maintained in this rather smaller storage room. The windowless walls, made of sturdy oak, are lined with horizontal, wooden shelves, till inches beneath the ten feet high ceiling. The northwestern wall is filled with cauldrons that need to be fixed, most of them exhibiting nasty bumps, but some with completely melted or cracked sides, which seem beyond repair. The southwestern wall holds very new, shining products, all sporting identical-looking notices carefully attached to them. Duplicates of the more popular kinds of cauldrons in the main stores are to be found on the southeastern wall, together with a strange-looking, brown cauldron, beside which lies a hand-written note, stuck to the wooden shelf beneath. A wooden door, leading back into the shop, stands to the northeast.

extradesc.desc: These cauldrons are alligned by sizes, the larger ones on the bottom shelves and the smaller ones higher up. Besides regular labels, specifying thickness, volume, and material, together with an approving stamp from the Ministry of Magic, the products each have the name of a person or institution and a date - probably a date of delivery - on them. The notices glow red if they are within five days of the current date, remaining obscurely-yellowing otherwise.

The brown cauldron is about the size of a Quaffle and made, surprisingly, of light wood, smelling of fresh pine and, strangely, parchment. In fact, although it looks like a cauldron when viewed from the side, it is, in fact, more like a sectioned part of a filled sphere. There wouldn't be enough room inside to hold a bezoar. A note in careful handwriting lies beside it, stuck to the shelf.

The note reads: "The Cauldron Book of Cauldrons - Light a gentle fire and place the book at a considerable height above it. It will open after about a minute of simmering." Beneath this, in a slightly-different and hurried handwriting, follows: "Note to self: Do NOT forget to put out the fire!"

room.name: Slug & Jiggers Apothecary - Storage Room
room.desc: This room is just as full as the Apothecary, if not more. Boxes, containing all sorts of potions needs, fill the majority of the area leaving very little space for anything else. The dark, wooden floor and shelves are packed with containers of every potion ingredient imaginable. A few candles, floating above this mess, illuminate the room, though weakly. Two candles have also been placed beside the two doors exiting this room, one for each. One of these doors goes south, back to the apothecary, and the other heads north.

roomecho.desc: A muffled explosion can be heard from one of the boxes.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Near Eeylops Owl Emporium
room.desc: Neat cobblestones cheefully stand in line along Diagon Alley, tracing a bright, well-tended pathway that runs southeast and west. Broad and ancient-looking, the way is surrounded by shops in various shapes and colours. To the northeast stands a stone building with a spacious display window, framed by heavy, scarlet curtains. Above the display window, a creative use of socks and shoes has resulted in the words 'Suchard's Shoes'. Beside it, to the north of this road, is the large, flamboyant, wooden store of 'Quality Quidditch Supplies'. A trail of grains, straw, and animal excretions leads south, into 'Eeylops Owl Emporium'.

roomecho.desc: An ear-splitting screech rings from the south.
A tiny, old witch, heavily bundled up in extra shawls and robes, passes by with a young girl in tow.

room.name: Suchard's Shoes
room.desc: To those who have never been here before, this room may be a bit disorientating. The walls are actually stone floors with mosaics imprinted in them. Upon these 'floor-walls', pearly-white feet stick out , each wearing a different pair of shoes. Each wall is labelled, one "Women", one "Men", and one "Boys/Girls". On what would be the ceiling are socks draping down like streamers, of diverse colours and patterns. Amid the chaos of the walls, the floor is stark, beyond a few benches to try shoes on, floor candelabras, and a desk with a large till and record book atop it. A door shaped like an attic access is embedded into the northern wall. To escape this cluttered shop one must leave through the door on the southwest wall or up the stairs.

roomecho.desc: The mosaics on the 'floor-walls' shift, deftly rearranging themselves so they shift the attention to random pairs of shoes.
A small gust of wind bathes the store in the fresh scent of dragon hide and leather.

room.name: Blunkett's Rare Books Back Room
room.desc: The dusty air in this wooden-floored chamber smells of old parchment and leather. Though seemingly cramped, it is difficult to tell how large the room truly is, as the walls, including the ceiling, are completely covered with overflowing bookshelves. The spine-festooned ceiling is low enough that most adults would have to stoop to enter. Lighting the dim, fusty repository are a few books, scattered amongst the other volumes, glowing lurid-red, sickly-green, or jaundiced-yellow. A dark gap between two tomes on the south-eastern wall promises a glimpse of what lies behind. The doorway to the north-west is bracketed by tall, precarious stacks of hardbound manuscripts.

extradesc.desc: The ceiling overhead is filled with shelves, as if it were just another wall. Several tons of reading material magically sits there, completely ignoring the laws of gravity. The northern corner of the ceiling is given over to wicker bins piled high with ancient-looking scrolls.

These teetering, swaying piles consist of hand-copied manuscripts sewn loosely into stiff covers. Among them are titles such as 'The Secret Rooms and Passages of Hogwarts', 'Weaknesses in Ministry Security', and 'Exploiting the Gaps in Modern Auror Training'. Each binding is stamped either in red with the words "Too Risky", in blue with the evaluation "Utter Nonsense", or green with the edict "Delightfully Wicked".
extradesc.keywords: doorway tall precarious stacks hardbound manuscripts stacked documents

extradesc.desc: Between "Cheating Death: A Grave Study" and "Power from Pain: Torture and Magic for Fun and Profit", a hand span's gap exposes yet another row of books. A fallen volume, "Scrutinizing The Foramen", exposes a shadowy recess.

Randomly spread among the stored volumes, the glowing books span topics from elementary curses to the brewing of poisons. They all do, however, have one thing in common: a golden seal on the spine that reads 'Published by: Illuminating Manuscripts'.
extradesc.keywords: books glowing lurid red sickly green jaundiced yellow light

roomecho.desc: The stacked documents to the left of the door sway perilously. A few sheets partly slip out of their bindings.
A bookshelf creaks; triggering a ghostly voice, "Abysm...Aaaabyyyysmmmm."

room.name: First Draft Diagon Alley - Near Scribbulus Everchanging Inks
room.desc: Diagon Alley runs to the east and west, running past a quiet, neat shop to the north. Above the rainbow-painted door is a sign reading "Scribbulus Everchanging Inks". The text colour shifts continuously through the spectrum, the different shades flowing from the beginning of the lettering, through to the last flourish of the final 's'. Behind the polished window is a display of parchment, bottles swirling with polychromatic inks, and other paraphernalia associated with writing. To the south, a boarded-up brick shop bears no sign at all. The street itself is tidy, from the well-swept cobbles to the impeccably-maintained buildings lining the way.

roomecho.desc: The sign on the shop to the north flashes from green to red and back.
A tall wizard carrying a multicolored bag exits Scribbulus Everchanging Inks, allowing the rainbow-hued door to swing shut behind him.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT Scribbulus Everchanging Inks
room.desc: This shop is substantially smaller than most of the other shops of Diagon Alley. The light cedar floors are sparsley populated with shelves against the walls showing off a few quills, ink colors, and some magically enhanced writing apparatus. The shopkeeper stands behind a wooden bar where an ancient till sits. To the south, the door leads back out to Diagon Alley, and to the north a staircase leads up somewhere. **********NEED TO ADD PARCHMENT TO STORE'S DESCRIPTION, POSSIBLE WINDOW DISPLAY? SCRIBBULUS IS ACTUAL CANON SHOP.********

room.name: Diagon Alley - Near Flourish & Blott's
room.desc: The cobblestone road that is Diagon Alley stretches through here, appearing the only support that keeps the northern and southern shops from collapsing. There are wooden pillars scattered across the from of both buildings, but they are old and withered, on the verge of collapsing themselves. To the north, ink-black letters, calligraphed onto a realistic immitation of a section of parchment standing above a large display read, "Flourish & Blotts". To the south, odd tools, like cauldron ladles and astrolabes, spell out the name of the store: "A Magi's Mechanisms" in startling blue. The path that runs through here appears infused on one side with the yellowing quality of parchment and on the other side with the funny shapes of the strangest of wizarding tools. The middle strip, which is smooth and brightly-white, broadens to encompass most of the road as it moves east and west.

extradesc.desc: A large window display fills the entire front side of Flourish & Blotts, on both sides of the door. Dark-blue, velvet cushions at the end of sturdy, stone pillars, hold impressive tomes, with red and gold inlay. The titles, written in the flourished caligraphy of early ages, read things like: "Family Spellbooke", and "The Wizarding Line". Small subtitles, written in gold in a slanted, legible hand, give an approximation of the year when the tomes were written. None is less than two and a half centuries old.

room.name: Flourish & Blott's
room.desc: This wooden room is almost entirely hidden by its stock. Books, books, books everwhere: from odd, thumbnail-sized books, with tiny scribbled words, to huge texts of wizarding history. The shop is orderly divided into regions: History, Muggles, Diviniation, Schoolbooks, Reference, Astronomy, Transfiguration, Potions, and many others, all noted with hanging, wooden signs. To the east, a small desk with a large lockbox is pushed against the wall. To the south is the road back to Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: ED small desk large lockbox The desk is made from the sturdiest of oak, with a well-polished surface, so as not to scratch the surfaces of any books that might come in contact with it. There is a stack of old parchment stuck to the left side, probably with a Permanent Sticking Charm. Vague shapes dance across its yellowing surface, looking sometimes like mere scribbles and sometimes like fully-fledged writing. The lockbox is old, appearing Muggle-made, but without a proper lock. Instead, a sheen of reddish smoke surrounds it, like a misty, vaporous guardian.

This ancient bit of parchment is torn and thinned out in places, as though frequently written upon. Writing dances upon it, as though triggered by the caress of an invisible breeze. Fragments like: 'Monster book of' and '7 Galleons, 2 Sickles' are visible, alongside unintelligible scribbles that look as though somebody tried their hand at writing.

room.name: A Magi's Mechanisms
room.desc: The inside of this store is fairly simple; the floors are made of white, square tiles and the walls are covered everywhere in dark, wooden shelves. Tools of all sorts are piled onto the shelves, with signs above each bookcase designating what is below. Security, Measurement, and Divination are but a few of the many categories. Larger equipment, such as a propped up Foe-Glass, large trunks, and big, wooden timepieces with irregular hands, rest out on display in the middle of the room. A simple door stands to the south, with a golden plaque that reads, "Authorised access only." A staircase near the back leads upwards and has a dangling sign reading "Astronomy" with a small, golden star drawn next to it. To the north, an orb-shaped door leads back to Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: The items on display are massive, made of the best of materials, surrounded by a red line, presumably some sort of anti-theft device. A Foe Glass, made of Venetian glass, stands propped against a large, brown trunk, with brass locks. The glass is completely clear and a golden plaque spells in silver writing beside it: 'A two-minute test: tap the Foe Glass with your wand and it will, for that time, show your enemies. The quickest, safest way of knowing when to watch out for whom. At the stunning price of only forty Galleons! ' A collection of other trunks are set around it artistically, to provide an ample view of their rounded, well-polished corners and sides. Upon nearly every one of them is a wizarding clock that shows anything from the time - in terms of planet movement - to a full agenda, with the possibility of easy adjustment. Although expensive, most of the products appear to justify their price.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Near Madam Malkin's
room.desc: The cobblestone road of Diagon Alley continues on here, running past three shops here before the bend in the path just to the west. To the north is a slate stone shop with a small door that reads, "Veritas Real Estate Office" in peeling letters. To the northwest is an old-looking, wooden shop, with quite a few customers bustling in and out of it. The sign above the shop reads, "Madam Malkin's - Robes for All Occasions". To the south is a neat patio with four wildly colored tables and just beyond that, Florean Fortescue's ice cream shop is visible. *****THE VERITAS REAL ESTATE OFFICE HAS BEEN MOVED. CHANGE THIS AREA ACCORDINGLY, TO MATCH WHERE MADAM MALKIN'S AND THE MAGICAL MENAGERIE ARE.*****

room.name: Magical Menagerie
room.desc: Upon entering this cluttered shop, the atmosphere explodes in a loud and frantic screeching, cawing, and growling of magical beasts. On the west wall, tanks filled with aquatic creatures - turtles with jeweled shells, singing fish, and constantly inflating and deflating frogs taking up the majority - are stacked upon one another. Cages holding other curious-looking creatures are scattered around the room. Colourful birds swoop around the room, every once in a while landing on the small, wooden, cashier's desk. To the south is the door leading out onto the streets of Diagon Alley.

roomecho.desc: A loud, unenthusiastic, loud sigh penetrates the cacophony of sounds, though it is impossible to say which creature is responsible for it.
A few, small, colourful birds screech at each other aggressively.

room.name: Florean Fortescue's Ice-Cream Parlour - Terrace
room.desc: The old, broken, cobblestone road of Diagon Alley leads here into a flat, paved, marble surface, which is the same colour as vanilla ice cream. Atop it sit four, differently-coloured tables, each with its own umbrella, probably provided so patrons and their frozen treats are shielded from any sunlight. To the south is the a shop marked with big, loopy letters, "Florean Fortescue's Ice Cream Parlour". The shop seems rather mistreated and ignored. The colours, which were once bright and vibrant have begun to fade a little, the bright blue of the stucco exterior reduced to a dull, shadowy grey. The windows are opaque and covered in grime. A sign is rather harshly nailed to the door. Diagon Alley continues its horizontal route to the north.

extradesc.desc: The sign nailed to the door is slammed into the wood with something resembling a Muggle railroad spike. The wooden sign has black text etched into it, so as to keep it more permanent than a simple parchment notice. The message reads, in capitalized, blocky letters, "CLOSED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. ENTRANCE IS CONSIDERED TRESPASSING BY AUTHORITIES AND WILL BE RESPONDED ACCORDINGLY."

room.name: Florean Fortescue's Ice-Cream Parlour - Shop
room.desc: This shop seems the most bizarre and wonderful place to get ice cream. The floors are covered in a rainbow of colors which are constantly changing to odd hues of every color. The walls are covered in a pale blue, which is covered in silver sparlkes exploding constantly. The doors to the north are usually swung open, allowing the sun to filter through. Various seats and couches covered in moving scenes, one portraying a thunderstorm, another a tornado swirling in the fabric itself, and another showing a wizard's duel. The counter is clear glass, showing off all the flavors sold in this shop. Behind the glass counter is a long marble bar covered in cones of varying colors, from cherry red, to the purple "Veela" flavor. Amid the wall covered in pictures of famous customers are barrels with taps in them. Some of the barrels are labled; Chocolate, Sprinkles, Syrup, Ketchup, Sauerkraut, and Spider Legs. To the west is a small door leading to a back door labled, "Staff Only"

room.name: Diagon Alley - A Turn in the Road
room.desc: Diagon Alley spills off into every direction here. The cobblestone main road continues east and southwest, curving to the west soon after the bend. The stone splits off to the northwest, rapidly declining in quality. The plain-brick shops to the north and west look new, unmarked with the exception of a "For Sale" sign on each door. To the south, a very serious, pristine looking shop displays a rare collection of sparkling, multicoloured jewelry through a diamond-shaped window. A large sign above the door reads, in delicate ruby-red writing, "Lady Gemma's Fine Jewelry".

roomecho.desc: A dusty, whipping wind passes through, whirling at this intersection for a moment before disintegrated with a shrill warcry.
A gnarled witch, looking very much as though she was made entirely of crooked parts, makes her way through, leaning against a wooden stick.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Outside SandWitches
room.desc: The well-treaded path widens as the grander stores of Diagon Alley approach. Although there are no weeds growing in the crack between the cobblestones, some flowers have found a good spot to grow towards the east, before a shop reading "For Sale". Ancient and occasionally cracked, the road keeps its dignity in its old age, except as it approaches a southern building, when random cobblestones suddenly disappear and reappear with a loud, popping noise. The tall, bright front of the southern shop is in fact full of disappearing, gleaming, shrieking, popping, and exploding items. Above two merchandise-filled windows are the brightly-coloured letters: 'Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes'. Opposite it, for the visitor in need of a good snack, possibly before they adventure into the joke shop, is SandWitches, a large ham and cheese sandwich above its tall and wide, wooden door. Diagon Alley continues west, towards Gringotts, and northeast, towards an intersection of ways.

extradesc.desc: Cobblestones keep appearing and disappearing in a wide area around the bright entrance to this store. Made of stone, sections of which randomly change colour to exhibit a product or another, the shop is drowned in a cacophony of sounds. Its two, large, front windows display rockets, flares, and fake wands levitating so that they seem to be duelling against each other just before turning into chickens, rats, or other things. Boards hang out of both windows, advertising different Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes products. The content of the boards changes every few minutes, just after the reader has had the time to properly imagine, or if lacking imagination, to see the vivid illustrations of, the wonders of the Puking Pastilles, the Nosebleed Nougat, or various forms of Stink Pellets.
extradesc.keywords: weasleys' Wizard Wheezes south joke shop

roomecho.desc: The sound of a small scale explosion is heard from the southern store, followed by screeches and howls of protest.
A couple of young wizards are forcibly drawn away from the southern store by their rather formidable-looking grandmothers.
The sandwich above SandWitches speaks, in a loud voice: 'Get your sandwich while it's hot, get your sandwich while it's cold, for all tastes and wishes, best sandwiches in all London!'

room.name: SandWitches - Best Sandwiches in all of London
room.desc: The linoleum tiles on the floor of this shop alternate from white to teal in a checkboard pattern. The lower half of the walls are covered in a brown, wooden paneling, with the upper half covered in Daily Prophet issues, showing major events of the past century. Pushed against the walls are mudbrick-red booths for people to sit in. To the north, a marble counter disrupts the harmony created by the other pieces of furniture within the store. Above the counter is a board showing possible sandwich ingredients and other food items to buy. There is a small, oak door to the north of the room, with no visible doorknob. To the south, a handsome front door leads into Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: The door is made of polished wood of a tawny colour. Ten feet high, it has a doorknob shaped like a ham and cheese sandwich, which releases an aroma of fresh pickles when turned. Tiny, squared windows are placed in eight rows of two windows each, at about a medium man's height. Another, half-moon window stands at the very top of the entrance.

room.name: Knockturn Alley Sewers
room.desc: Harsh, stone-slashed walls envelop the cold, cramped surroundings of this desolate sewer intersection. The dampened sides reflect multifarious shades of grey light across their slick surfaces; trickles of water snake along the anfractuous, glistening grooves they've formed. The floor is blanketed in a shallow stratum of mist that travels this culvert. Four lamp-lights hang on each corner of this crossroad, highlighting the eastern and western exits. Distant flickers of light dance across the clammy walls, revealing paths to the south-east and north-west.

extradesc.desc: Made of wrought iron and creaking in a silent wind, these glowing enclosures try to keep the shadows from swallowing this area entirely.
A writhing, ashen-grey layer of mist obscures the floor from view.

roomecho.desc: A loud splash up ahead pierces the suffocating silence.

room.name: An Intriguing Intersection
room.desc: Diagon Alley narrows at this point, as if trying to funnel people from the shadowy, unwelcoming void to the south. The grandiose, pure-white building of Gringott's Wizarding Bank rises to the north, its buffed, bronze doors lending it even more cachet. The gleaming exterior is a complete antithesis to the sight of Knockturn Alley slinking opposite it. The ground mist pouring from the entrance seeps over the black cobblestones, entwining nearby ankles in its icy grip. Eager to leave this area, the street opens up to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: Due to much of Gringott's Bank being underground, this edifice is not particularly tall. However, the effect of sharply-cut, white marble walls, fat Corinthian columns, and the huge, burnished-bronze entrance is one of impressive grandeur and meticulous attention to detail.
extradesc.keywords: north Gringott's Wizarding Bank building white

extradesc.desc: The entrance to this, the darkest recess of Diagon Alley, is like a great maw. Dark buildings hunch over each other, their shop signs glinting like fangs. Through the mist being vomited out from the gloom, one can see flitting shadows and brief flashes of green light.
In the wider section of street to the east, the sign for 'SandWitches', can be seen swaying gently in the breeze.
To the west, a great many mannequins clutter an otherwise open intersection. A waving banner of fine silk can be seen, bearing the woven words, "Andros's Attire".

roomecho.desc: A guttural roar reverberates from the south.

room.name: Gringotts Steps
room.desc: The cobblestone path of Diagon Alley stumbles shyly before the magnificent, white building of Gringotts. The largest wizarding bank in England takes up the entire northern side of the road, ionic columns supporting its massive, luxurious entrance. Stone steps, worn thin by the frequent, heavy traffic, lead to a pair of burnished, bronze doors. To the east is an attractive, cosy terrace. A three feet high, stone wall stands between this square and the terrace, forcing the thirsty traveller to take the southern, longer way. Upon the wall stand statues of Goblins, dressed in full war attire; the snarls on their faces visible above the round edges of their shields. A white fountain whispers in gentle, caressing tones just at the feet of the stairs.

extradesc.desc: The fountain is circular, made of milky-white stone. In the centre of it, a statue of a dancing witch turns slowly, water rushing in clear whispers from her delicate, upturned palms. The clear water spills upon a glistening, white bed of river pebbles, the splashes soothing like a whispered melody.

roomecho.desc: A sweet song travels on the breeze, coming from the white fountain in the centre of the square.
An exotic, strange kind of charged warchant spills from the harsh wind, its source unknown.

room.name: Knockturn Alley
room.desc: Hunched, mud stained walls descend to dark, decrepit stone lining this section of street. Even in broad daylight, Knockturn Alley seems to shrink into the shadows. Blackened, polluted vines snake along two dusty lampposts, clinging to the surrounding walls and giving the street an ancient, foreboding appearance. The alleyway stretches into obscurity to the south-west, passing shops and grungy inns as it slithers on. To the north, the old, worn, white cobblestones of Diagon Alley can be seen. Peltrudes Divination lies to west and an empty shop inhabits the eastern building.

extradesc.desc: The tall, steel lampposts are fashioned to resemble an enormous snake. They begin as a twisted, coiling base then shoot upright until the very top, the heads staring down over the street, as if ready to strike. The baleful eyes and cruel lower jaws of the serpent emit a sickly-green glow. The dim radiance seems to be an effort to startle, rather than light the street.

roomecho.desc: A chilly wind shrieks and hisses through the narrow street.

room.name: Knockturn Alley
room.desc: This narrow alley is shadowed by looming buildings and overhanging eaves. The funereal gloom is ceaseless, even at midday. The cobbled street is a treacherous ruin of potholes and slime. The slabs of pavement are equally mired by a series of jagged lines and grooves worn into the dull surface. A rusted, iron lamppost casts just enough light to see the sign on the mouldering, half-timbered building to the northwest. To the east, a dark gap between two boarded-up windows allows access to a chained and padlocked door of a vacant shop. The street leads some distance northeast and southwest, murky shadows permanently obscuring the view ahead.

extradesc.desc: The gaps in the cobblestone surface of the alley are filled with wet, stinking debris. Over time, the decomposing matter has become a sticky, uniform, brown sludge, housing a variety of crawling things. The filthy surface of each puddle churns in nauseating witness to the unseen vermin that make their homes in the muck.

The slabs of stone making up the pavement are roughly two by three feet. Though grime-filled and chipped, some of the grooves are recognizable as letters: 'RIP' and 'Here Lies' being among the most common.
extradesc.keywords: slabs pavement lines grooves dull surface

extradesc.desc: Creaking even when still, this hanging board, suspended over the rickety door, depicts a wounded, blue-scaled dragon in a nest of sharp stones.

room.name: Knockturn Alley
room.desc: The aged buildings that line this alley huddle together like conspirators, leaning over the street as if to whisper secrets to the haggard edifices across the way. The shadowed cobbles are uneven and webbed with cracks. To the north is the venerable storefront of Borgin and Burkes. The begrimed glass door of a boarded-up shop to the east is fastened shut by a thick, black chain and a heavy, iron padlock. To the south, a sign swinging over the brick storefront reads 'Muddlestone's Malicious Monstrosities'. The initials 'MMM' adorn the grey, metal entrance. In the south-eastern corner, beneath a stooped archway, is a single, red door. The gloomy street is obscured by a dense fog to the west and northeast.

extradesc.desc: With no handle, knocker, or feature marking the flat, crimson impasse, there seems to be no way through.
extradesc.keywords: red door single stooped archway south-eastern corner

extradesc.desc: Through the dirty windows, one can make out a counter, some half-collapsed shelving, and an unhinged door leading out back. The entire interior seems to be drowned in dust and cobwebs.
extradesc.keywords: glass begrimed boarded-up shop east thick chain iron padlock

roomecho.desc: A creature the size of a badger, but with the long, hairless tail of a rat, scuttles by.

room.name: Borgin & Burkes
room.desc: The austere, timeworn floor of Borgin & Burkes bears testament to the hundreds of footsteps that have sauntered through here. Though this is the most frequented shop in Knockturn Alley, the air inside is stifling and stale. Lining the cold, stone walls are a series of shoddily-fastened shelves holding a variety of musty jars, curios, and fusty miscellanies. Several displays are positioned throughout the shadowy room, each with a grotesque offering: staring eyes in putrid-yellow bottles, jars of severed hands, miniature gallows, and strings of shrunken heads. Standing at an awkward angle, a tall, wooden cabinet lurks by the far wall, partially obscured from view. Silver instruments dangle from the eastern wall, their various spikes and edges persistently abrading the stone. An ebony, glass-paned door to the south, with a tinkling bell above it, leads into the alley.

extradesc.desc: Leaning against the wall for support and wreathed in gloom, this large, black cabinet is one of the few pieces in the room seemingly not on display. Carved into its deep, pine surface are intricate, other-worldly glyphs. The brass handles on the front door, shaped like eyeballs, do not budge.

The shelves are constructed from pitted, solid oak. Most of the jars on display contain various blackened fragments of animals or humans, submerged in a viscous fluid. Hovering above each jar, minute, faintly iridescent, silver writing describes the contents within. Some of the larger, brighter labels read: "Eye of the Stricken - must be carried in a silver receptacle, blinds on sight."; "Hand of the Inferius - do not touch, poisonous!"; "Bone of the Accursed - a grain and your enemy will die a slow, natural-looking death."

roomecho.desc: A hard, muffled thump resounds from somewhere in the shadows.

room.name: Knockturn Alley
room.desc: The dull, crumbling, stone pathway winds its way between two prominent shops towering over this segment of the street. Leaning out at an unnatural angle, a small, feeble lamp swings noisily from its position on the southern building. A sharp, likely-toxic aroma of simmering potions emanates from within the southern premises. The edifice opposite is made conspicuous by the rank, earthy stench of unkempt beasts and the even fouler smell of their droppings. In the centre of the street, the scents of both buildings mix to create an acrid, overpowering odour. The street continues to the east and west.

extradesc.desc: Forever doomed to sway, this pathetic light proclaims its misery with a grating, rusted shriek. Shrouded in tinted glass, the weak glow from within casts a green pallor on all it reaches.

Scorched cursive above the door reads "Sweet Vengeance", a fitting title for this particularly unpleasant shop. Chipped, mossy-green paint covers the walls. The ground directly beneath is similarly hued where flakes of paint have fallen, to the effect that the building seems to melt into the stone.

Thick, wrought-iron bars secure the windows and door of this shop, the muddy, smeared glass bearing the simple title, "The Beastiary". Through the grime, a few piercing, black eyes can be seen staring out of large, dark cages.
The cobblestone street leads deeper into Knockturn Alley to the west and towards a curve in the road to the east.
Through the imposing facades, a small strip of the sky is barely visible. Gargoyles leer down from the emptying spigots, occasionally pointing at unwitting passers-by, marking them for a dousing.

roomecho.desc: A loud howl can be heard from the north.
A great column of water descends from above, splashing everything nearby.

room.name: The Beastiary
room.desc: Within the dingy, cacophonous main room, the smell of rank, unkempt animals hangs like a fog in the thick air. A small lantern dangles in the centre of the room, emitting barely enough light to reveal the immediate surroundings, much less the rest of this large, overly-cramped shop. A churning symphony of cawing, croaking, screeching, and howling emanates from every direction. A horde of creatures- mammals, reptiles, fowl, insects -all creep, crawl, slither, scuttle, and flurry within their varied enclosures. The slanted eyes of rare and dangerous beasts glint from the shadows of their magically fortified cages behind the cashier's desk in the back of this beastly boutique. The door to the south leads back to the street while the door to the northeast allows access to the storeroom.

extradesc.desc: The flickering flame within this grimy enclosure throws out feeble, fleeting stabs of amber light into the forest of fur and feathers below.
A solid, squat box of cherry wood, engraved with a two-headed snake sits on the counter. The scrawled label beside it reads "runespoors".

Mounted on a walnut plaque, this is one of the closest glimpses a wizard can get of the legendary creature. Its feline eyes stare coldly at wandering visitors, following them perniciously until they leave.
A large, muddy door leads out through an archway to the south, while a reinforced slab of oak bars the way beneath the nundu head to the north-east.
The head of a nundu hangs above the north-eastern door, two mammoth fangs protruding viciously from its open maw.

roomecho.desc: The dim lantern extinguishes for a moment, temporarily plunging the room into darkness.

room.name: Sweet Vengeance
room.desc: Upon entering "Sweet Vengeance", one is assailed by the choking, acrid smells of the myriad poisons sold here. Tall, thick candles drench this room in an unhealthy glow. The acidic light stabs through the dust-heavy air, bringing the contents of the shop into dim view. Toxins, venoms, vitriolic powders, coagulants, astringents, and other malicious liquids fill the countless bottles and jars lining the decayed shelving that covers the shop. Bubbling cauldrons and fuming mortars can be seen towards the rear of the store beneath the sign "Brew your own". Behind the huge, bronze counter, the slimy stone walls are laced with sharp, rusted hooks. Several vials of virulent purples, lurid greens, and pustulant yellows hang from these cruel-looking barbs, pulsating with a sickly internal light. The glass-fronted cabinet below the counter contains several metal devices glinting in the candlelight. A heavy, black curtain covers a south-eastern exit, while an iron-barred door to the north leads out to Knockturn Alley.

extradesc.desc: Shaped like a waxen mound of miniature skulls wreathed in snakes, the pus-coloured candles throw up violent gouts of white flame, illuminating the contents of the shop.

Beneath the bronze-plated, worn counter, incarcerated behind thick sheets of glass, several silver instruments for weighing, dissecting, and mixing potions are on display. They are particularly stylised to emphasise cutting and separating, each periphery finely-sharpened to a razor edge.
extradesc.keywords: glass-fronted cabinet counter metal devices glinting

extradesc.desc: The deep, raven folds of fabric guarding this door clearly mark it as private. Upon approach, the material billows out to block the way, unless of course, you are invited, in which case they simply part with a silent, humble reverence.
Reinforced with strong iron bars, the green, painted door to the north leads back out into Knockturn Alley.

roomecho.desc: The black curtain, guarding the entrance to the back room, flutters from some unfelt draft.
A small plume of white fire shoots into the air, setting off an automatic deluge of water from above.

room.name: A Very Dead End
room.desc: Bordered on all sides by stooped, menacing buildings, the notorious Knockturn Alley stumbles here to its strangled, shady end. Pitted, centuries-old stone, cracked in many places, lies underfoot, reminiscent of a hag's wrinkled face. An eerie stillness hangs over the dark, dead end, as though pinned down by the very fabric of the fetid air. No living plants grow here - not even musty, old ivy or the all-too-familiar, slimy algae. The place is barren. An intoxicating stench of strong drink lingers about the well-worn inn to the west - a direct contrast to the polished, inky-black marble of the hotel dominating the southwestern corner. A grey, tombstone-like building stands to the north, while ornate, ebony wood frames the front window of a sinister jewellery store to the south. Torchlight from the east feebly stabs into the gloom, marking the only path away from this cul-de-sac of misery.

extradesc.desc: The blue-black flagstones underfoot look as if they were placed at the dawn of time.
A battered sign hangs over the rotten facade of the inn, bearing the word "Zambrovski's" in peeling, golden lettering.

This implacable shadow of a building towers over the whole area. Bounded by stout, lofty pillars of black marble, it proudly bears the carved epitaph, "The Hor Ryfic Hotel". The front door, made of burnished pewter, revolves slowly.

The building is a narrow rectangle of unnaturally perfect proportions. Made of heavy, grey stone with a matte-black door placed dead centre, every detail of the structure is executed with an exacting taste.
Ornate ebony wood curls around the dark glass like a lurking spider. Silvery light glints off the contents on display, tempting people inside.
extradesc.keywords: ebony wood frame front window jewellery store south

roomecho.desc: A soot-black raven swoops down from overhead, gliding into an open window of the hotel.
A muffled, miserable cry issues faintly through the walls of the northern building.

room.name: Knockturn Alley Sewers
room.desc: Three tunnels merge into one; their arched, brick ceilings melding together at abnormal angles. Brick-walled passages, drawing one to the west, northeast, and southeast, disappear into the inky darkness. Granite cones, placed every five feet along the wall, are fastened in iron straps at head-height. Each conoid holds a fist-sized gout of enchanted flame. The blood-red light extravasating from the cones creates elongated shadows, like flickering wraiths. The abrasive, undressed stone of the floor is saturated with foul-smelling water pooling in every tiny depression. The hundreds of tiny puddles reflect the torchlight.

extradesc.desc: The carved, granite torches are smooth to the touch. The stone is indented, allowing the iron bands to fit flush with the surface. Discoloured from years in the damp environment, the straps drip rusty stains down the speckled body of each torch.
extradesc.keywords: granite cones iron straps light conoid enchanted blood-red blood red

roomecho.desc: A drop of murky water drips from above, splintering the puddles' reflections into shards of sanguine light.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Outside Merenda Cafe
room.desc: The smooth Diagon Alley cheerfully slides along, its cobblestones smooth and clean, slightly worn around the edges from much use. To the south rises a tall building, made of irregularly-placed bricks, as though designed by someone who had only the slightest idea of how architecture should be made to hold. The consequently irregular-shaped, but polished windows display mannequins covered in colourful, simple, Muggle attire. The words Andros' Attire are painted in bold black letters on the wooden front door. To the north, a large, stone platform, decorated with exquisitely-shaped tables. Comfortable steps carved into the stone lead up to the yard-high terrace. To the east, the main road slips before Gringotts; to the west, the alley passes by an important, severe-looking building.

extradesc.desc: The mannequins in the window are shapely, modelled to fit the clothes that hang on the perfectly. They occasionally move, showing off the traits of the particular fashion they advertize. The combinations are stunning, ranging from blue jeans, with an exquisite, embroidered blouse and mauve carpet slippers for ladies to a silk shirt, with a woolen vest, Bermuda shorts, and cowboy boots for gentlemen. A large sign pressed against the upper part of the window reads: 'Small to Tall, We've got it All. Come into Andros' Attire for the finest Muggle clothing in the wizarding world. ' A small, rounded, medallion-like image underneath shows a knitting troll in a suitable-sized rocking chair.

roomecho.desc: A low, deep, soothing whisper of wind passes through, caressing the smooth Diagon Alley.

room.name: Merenda Cafe - Terrace
room.desc: An elevated, stone platform, of a faded, red-brown colour, sits here, standing a yard high. Wrapped around it is a black, lattice fence, made of metal and broken in one place - a staircase cut into the platform. Atop it are dark-green, circular tables, all held up by emerald, lion-shaped pillars. To the north is a building with large windows; a hanging, green sign before it reads, "Merenda Cafe" in a loopy, ruby-red, cursive writing. To the south lies the friendly Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: The tables are large, made of light wood painted dark-green. Matching, lion-shaped pillars support them in the centre, their chests moving slightly as though they were breathing. Each table has four, straight-backed chairs, with legs carved to resemble lion cubs. The young lions one the right side of the seats have their front, left paws playfully lifted off the ground, as though ready to chase away insects, while the ones on the left side have their front, right paws up.
extradesc.keywords: dark-green green circular tables emerald lion pillars

room.name: Diagon Alley - Outside Magical Menagerie
room.desc: A small shop, covered in peeling grey paint, lies to the north. Large, grimy windows show the chaos of magical beasts running everywhere within the shop. A small rectangular sign which reads "Magical Menagerie" in red block letters is tacked onto the wall above the door. Unlike the rest of the buliding, the sign appears to be new and is decorated with a painted border of animal paws. To the south is an unused shop, and to the west and east cntinue the winding street. ****THE MAGICAL MENAGERIE HAS BEEN MOVED AND THE VERITAS REAL ESTATE PLACE TO THIS AREA. CHANGE THIS DESC ACCORDINGLY.*****

room.name: A Brightly-Lit Intersection
room.desc: . Black, iron-banded lanterns, on either side of this intersection, shed a glaring white light on the eroded brickwork of the walls and ceiling,. Every chipped corner, every crumbling fragment of mortar is thrown into high relief, outlined in crisp shadows. Even the dark green algae, growing in a trickle of water from the leaking stone ceiling, is clearly visible in every slimy detail. The rippled and pockmarked slate of the floor is a moonscape of over-exposed, grey rock and sharp-edged, black shade. The gloom shrouding the corridors to the north, east, and west is deepened by comparison.

extradesc.desc: The lamps appear to be more cage than lamp, with reinforced panels of tempered glass held between riveted iron bars. At the very bottom of the wrought-iron base, a single glowing coal is held in a wire-mesh cup. Around the coal huddles the source of the excruciating light: a salamander.
extradesc.keywords: black lanterns iron-banded lamps painfully white light

extradesc.desc: An oily, green stain clings to the mottled masonry as a thin film of murky water flows over it. With the light glinting off its surface, it looks like a bleeding, infected wound in the wall itself.
The darkness is too complete to penetrate from here.
The darkness is too complete to penetrate from here.
The darkness is too complete to penetrate from here.

roomecho.desc: The light dims for a moment. A flash of motion is visible inside the western lantern, only to be lost in the renewed glare.
The light flares brightly, and something stirs inside the eastern lantern.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Outside Discount Drave's
room.desc: To the north a shabby shop looks as though it is about to fall over. A simple white sign above it reads, "Discount Drave's". To the south a building with no windows is labled, "Reyna's Garden Supplies" and it's walls are lined with flower stalls. A man stands ready to take the money for anyone's purchases.

room.name: Discount Drave's
room.desc: This shop is huge, however, the size of the room is well hidden by the clutter. The walls are lined with dusty, warped shelves packed with various old, used, and broken things. The remaining space is filled with rolling metal carts containing trinkets, and old, out of style clothing. An old, well used desk stands behind it all with a dusty pricebook and a metal strongbox sitting on top.

room.name: Reyna's Garden Supplies
room.desc: On clouded days it is even more obvious that this room is bewitched to look like a greenhouse. The ceiling shows a blue, sunny day through a glossy, translucent glass. The floor is covered in garden soil, with only a stone walkway between plots. Next to each flower bed is a stack of empty pots. Near the back are piles of bags of soil and manure, and a fenced-off area that contains hazardous plants. A sign on the fence wall reads, 'Do not approach! Do not feed the plants!" Along the east wall is a bench covered in various gardening tools, along with an odd-looking pair of earmuffs. It is nearly impossible to spot the northern door once inside, as a curtain of willow branches naturally falls over it.

extradesc.desc: At first sight, most of the plants in this section look utterly harmless, decorated with beautiful, scarlet flowers. Only a closer look may reveal that there are funnily-shaped tongues amongst the soft petals and that the surrounding sepals have sharp edges, like tiny teeth. For some of the larger plants, all pretence of friendliness is gone, their predatory, ivy-coloured teeth curved against the surface of permanently-open flowers. Tiny imitations of hands serve as leaves on either side; they move continuously, as though sensing the air for possible prey.

roomecho.desc: A loud snap is heard as an unfortunate insect finds its death in the hazardous section.

room.name: Diagon Alley - In Front of the Daily Prophet
room.desc: An impressive building towers over Diagon Alley from the north, dwarfing any surrounding shops. It may be but a newspaper office, but it appears more like a fortress. A large, central tower of tan stone stretches four stories upward and wings jut off to the east and west, built over of the shops that are in the way. Atop the square bottom of the tower, just above the door, are the cursive words, "The Daily Prophet" as though written onto the stone itself. A huge number of owls roost in a house-sized hut kept on the highest roof, west of the tower. To the south, attempting in vain to rival The Daily Prophet, is a pompous, lower building, with an ellegantly-curved sign reading "Wireless Wizarding Network Headquarters" . A rather extraordinary, large, twisting spire of coloured columns rise out of it, ending in a sharp point. The pillar hums and glows faintly, as though giving off energy. Diagon Alley cheerfully goes on east and west.

roomecho.desc: The cheerful bickering of a few birds penetrates through the surrounding sounds of Diagon Alley.
A tall, slim woman robed in black passes through, looking preoccupied.

room.name: The Daily Prophet - Rotunda - Main Floor
room.desc: This room's grandeur matches that of Gringotts. The deep green marble walls seem to stretch up forever, the soaring ceiling held up by massive pillars. The walls themselves are round, thus giving this room's name, "The Rotunda". Covering one section of the wall is a curved painting of a Prophet issue that changes from historic event to historic event. To the north, a grand, curling staircase entwines itself around the tower of the rotunda, steps leading all the way to the top floor. White balconies line the staircases outer edge, to ensure no one falls to their deaths as they surely would. A piece of marble juts out from the staircase, forming the front desk where two witches sit with stacks of parchment, quills and ink, along with a cage of flying paper origami birds. Behind the two witches is a small fireplace that is filled with more crumpled up parchment than wood. Walls lead off in different directions here on the first floor, to the west a door says, "Printing", to the east it says, "News Room".

room.name: Wireless Wizard Network HQ - Main Lobby
room.desc: The lobby of the WWN is quite simply designed. The floor is made of light grey granite, with neither breaks, nor cracks. The walls are made of stained cedar with various paintings of scenic mountain sides, rocky harbours, and grassy meadows. Fireplaces stand on both the west and east walls, with a silver jar on each labeled, "Floo". At the back of the southern wall is a squared, plain desk, meant for receptionists. Above the reception desk, a written message in cursive reads: "Wireless Wizarding Network - Informing the Wizarding Community for a Century." A small, unlabeled door is barely distinguishable against the south wall. To the north is a more ornate door, leading out into Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: The paintings are all in good taste, with nothing excentric or very modernistic in them; simple landscapes filled with life. Most are oil paintings in clear, vivid blue and green, depicting quiet fragments of village life. What is interesting is that any characters appearing against the surrounding masses of colours wear the robes and pointed hats of wizards and witches. These are only replaced when the participating wizards are dressed very inexpertly in Muggle clothing, at witch burnings.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Outside Arousing Aromas
room.desc: The north of Diagon Alley stands in the shadow of the large complex that is the Daily Prophet headquarters. The main entrance into the building stands further east, but wrapped around two jade pillars is a large, square stand, filled with newspapers. Large, ink-black letters on a sign above it spell the words: "Prophet Issues - Fresh off the Presses". Hanging from the top of the stand are brigtly-coloured packages of gum and small satchels of jelly beans. On the other side of the road is a building made of dark wood, bearing large, clean windows. Words that appear to be made of flaming-crimson smoke read, "Arousing Aromas". Large smoke stacks stick out of the dark roof, emitting grey puffs of smoke. The main road continues further west, passing on between dusty shops.

roomecho.desc: A few owls pass by, seeking the higher rooftops along the way.
Two young wizards rebelliously fight their mother as she tries to hold them in check.

room.name: Arousing Aromas
room.desc: The long room is upholstered with light cherrywood, giving off a cherry-flavoured perfume. A thick layer of smoke swirls about the ceiling, going out large holes in the stone surface. The foggy upper part of the chamber jumbles the perspectives so that one moment the shop looks thin and long, while another it seems wide and rounded. The light, slightly-sharp smell of vanilla is nearly drowned by the heavy, velvety scents of cocoa and dark chocolate. An assortment of tables, of all shapes and materials and ornated with perfumed candles, is scattered across the room. A display case with a glass front stands to the south filled with all manner of baked goods, illuminated to their full splendour by radish-shaped, red candles. A cashier's box discreetly lies away from the main light, behind a stack of ellegant, pink or blue boxes with the silver or golden letters spelling "AA" in cursive. A beautiful, northern door leads into Diagon Alley.

extradesc.desc: The shop provides an impressive amount of products, ranging from the size of a Galleon to that of a Quidditch hoop. All have labels beside them, indicating the name and main ingredients of the savoury products. There are fruitcakes, with different combination of fruit decorating them - mango, passion fruit, and kiwi for the "Tarta exotica"; strawberry, cherry, cranberry, and grapes for the "Cherry-berry mix"; peach, apple, pear, and apricots for the "European Deluxe". Chocolate is draped in dark curtains all over the top and sides of the "Black Promise", which contrasts nicely with the nearby "Golden Innocence", made of vanilla and abundant cream. Every sort of cake comes in six sizes, depending on how many Shrinking or Engorgement charms are used on it. Tiny bowls of more conventional chocolates stand beside similar bowls of "Flaming Firechocks", "Chocolate Frogs", and "Coffee Gargoyles", which flame, leap, and fly around the confines of the glass display. A special Stunner stands beside an ellegant little flat spoon used to pick up the smaller range of sweets.

roomecho.desc: The smoke dances against the ceiling, lighting crimson for a moment before slipping out a gaping hole.

room.name: Diagon Alley - Near Ollivander's
room.desc: This cobblestone street extends east and west. To the north is a small, neat shop with walls made of dark, wooden boards. Above the arched door is a square sign reading "Ollivander's" in shining, gold letters. The dark windows are covered in a thin layer of dust, making the inside of the store indiscernible. To the south of the street is a Q-shaped building. The sign hanging over the round door explains the odd shape - this store is home to the highly-discussed newspaper, The Quibbler.

roomecho.desc: A stuffy breeze clings for a moment to the walls of Olivander's, drawing in a fresh supply of dust before moving on.
A few pidgeons fly overhead, conversing in soft, low gurglings.

room.name: FIRST DRAFT Callantrho's Living Room
room.desc: The spiraling stair comes up from the floor below, its banister continuing to curl up through this level in the northeast corner of the room. A scarlet wallpaper with small swirls akin waves sprawling over the walls and the ceiling. A golden chandalier stems down from the center of the ceiling, its branches curl out like elephant tusks into a small platform for candles. The off-white, almost ivory candles glow with a dim light individually, which in sum results in the room being lit fairly well. In the center of the room, directly under the chandalier are two high-backed chair of dark leather. A small, circular table of mahogany sits in between the two chairs, with two coasters atop it. A large fireplace of dark wood is on the southern wall, the mantle reaching up to the neck of most tall men.
